item.title: Russian Sanctions Risk Straining Trump’s Chummy Relationship With Hungarian Leader
item.description: New U.S. penalties on Russian energy could be a sticking point as President Trump and Prime Minister Viktor Orban of Hungary meet.

item.title: As Saudi Arabia Cracks Down on Drugs, Executions Near a Record High
item.description: Facing an influx of amphetamines, the kingdom has put hundreds of people to death, many of them foreigners convicted of low-level smuggling.

item.title: 10 Years After the Paris Climate Agreement, Here's Where We Are
item.description: Has anything really changed in the decade since the Paris Agreement was reached? Actually, quite a lot.

item.title: Why Germany Is Still Divided When It Comes to Russia
item.description: Many East Germans are more sympathetic toward Moscow than their western compatriots, reflecting decades of Soviet ties and disillusionment since reuni...

item.title: Trump’s Tariffs Scar Canadian City Where Cars Have Been Made for Decades
item.description: An automaker’s decision to shift Canadian jobs to the United States has left workers in Brampton, Ontario, feeling betrayed and angry.
